video:video.video:title: How This Next Billion-Dollar Startup Founder Went From Intern To CEO
video:video.video:description: Often, it takes just one person, one investor, cofounder, or even customer, to make an entrepreneurial dream a reality. For Andrew Lau, it was Phil Braden and Dave Gourley who changed it all. Dave first hired Andrew as an intern in 1999, when they were both working for a tech startup in Boston. Shortly thereafter, Andrew, Dave and Phil found themselves working together in the early 2000s at Endeca, an e-commerce search engine acquired by Oracle for more than $1 billion in 2011. Eventually, the trio joined forced to cofound Jellyfish, a software company aiming to do for engineering what Salesforce did for marketing. Jellyfish landed on the Forbes list of the Next Billion-Dollar Startups in 2023 and Andrew, once the intern of the group, is the company's CEO. This journey would not have been possible, he says, with anyone other than Dave and Phil.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Managing Music, Mental Health And Making It Big: A Town Hall With Big Sean
video:video.video:description: Featuring Big Sean, GRAMMY-Nominated Artist, Author and Entrepreneur, and interviewed by Jabari Young, Senior Writer & ForbesBLK Editorial Lead, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Pitch Perfect: Raising Cash In Today?s Economy
video:video.video:description: Featuring Seth Corder, Partner, High Alpha, Falon Donohue, Partner, Narya Capital, Kevin Vilkin, Cofounder & Managing Partner, Emergent Strategic Partners, and moderated by Alexandra York, Associate Editor, Under 30, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Game On: How To Drive Massive Growth And Customer Loyalty
video:video.video:description: Featuring Andrew Powell, Cofounder & CEO, Learn To Win, Judy Thelen, Cofounder & CEO, Beli and moderated by Jabari Young, Senior Writer & ForbesBLK Editorial Lead, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Social Media Breakout Stars? Guide To Diversifying Your Brand
video:video.video:description: Featuring Bobbi Althoff, Comedian & Podcast Host, Tori Dunlap, Founder & CEO, Her First $100K, XANDRA, Content Creator & DJ, and moderated by Alexandra York, Associate Editor, Under 30, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Loud And Clear: Using Your Voice To Build A Brand And Movement
video:video.video:description: Featuring Drew Afualo, Content Creator, Women?s Rights Advocate, Podcast Host and New York Times Best-Selling Author, and interviewed by Maggie McGrath, Editor, ForbesWomen and Senior Editor, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Pro Playbook: How To Become A Master Storyteller In An Ever-Changing World
video:video.video:description: Featuring Joe Buck, Monday Night Football Play-by-Play Commentator, ESPN, and interviewed by Randall Lane, Chief Content Officer & Under 30 Founder, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Sweet Success: How To Build And Sell A Hundred Million Dollar Start-up
video:video.video:description: Featuring Beatrice Dixon, Cofounder & CEO, The Honey Pot Company, and interviewed by Maggie McGrath, Editor, ForbesWomen and Senior Editor, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Lessons From Two Business Legends
video:video.video:description: Featuring Ken Chenault, Chairman & Managing Director, General Catalyst and Former Chairman & CEO, American Express, Ken Frazier, Chairman of Health Assurance Initiatives, General Catalyst and Former Chairman & CEO, Merck, and moderated by Steven Bertoni, Assistant Managing Editor, Founders, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Creator Cash: Turning Millions Of Followers Into Millions In Sales
video:video.video:description: Featuring Dani Austin, Internet Personality & Founder, Divi, Amber Venz Box, Cofounder & President, LTK, and moderated by Maneet Ahuja, Editor-at-Large & Founder, Iconoclast, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Playing To Win: Life Lessons From The Boardroom To The Owner?s Box
video:video.video:description: Featuring Josh Harris, Founder, 26North, Founder, Harris Blitzer Sports & Entertainment and Managing Partner, Washington Commanders, Philadelphia 76ers and New Jersey Devils, and moderated by Maneet Ahuja, Editor-at-Large & Founder, Iconoclast, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Cracking The Storytelling Code For The Next Generation
video:video.video:description: Featuring Robyn Delmonte, Content Creator & Consultant, Katie Welch, Chief Marketing Officer, Rare Beauty, and moderated by Alexandra York, Associate Editor, Under 30, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Brewing Up A New Billion Dollar Industry
video:video.video:description: Featuring Bill Shufelt, Cofounder & CEO, Athletic Brewing Company, Justin Tidwell, Cofounder & CEO, Nowadays and moderated by Steven Bertoni, Assistant Managing Editor, Founders, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: From Musician To Mogul
video:video.video:description: Featuring Metro Boomin, GRAMMY Award-Nominated Diamond-Certified Producer, DJ and Artist, and interviewed by Matt Craig, Reporter, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Developing A Brand That Gen Z Will Love
video:video.video:description: Featuring Jordan Bentley, Founder & CEO, Hypland, Jenny Lei, Founder, Freja New York, Jenk Oz, Founder & CEO, Thred Media, and moderated by Alexandra York, Associate Editor, Under 30, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Beating The Odds: Turning Youth Into A Competitive Advantage
video:video.video:description: Featuring Haley Cavinder, Basketball Player, Miami Hurricanes & Cofounder, Hustle Beauty, Hanna Cavinder, Basketball Player, Miami Hurricanes & Cofounder, Hustle Beauty, Midge Purce, NWSL and U.S. Women?s National Team Player, and moderated by Moira Forbes, President and Publisher, ForbesWomen & Executive Vice President, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Bilt To Grow: From The Under 30 To Billionaire List
video:video.video:description: Featuring Ankur Jain, Founder & CEO, Bilt Rewards, interviewed by Mike Federle, CEO, Forbes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Spotlight: Unlocking Financial Freedom
video:video.video:description: Featuring Tori Dunlap, Founder & CEO, Her First $100K.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit: Spotlight: The AI Roadmap: Steering Businesses Toward An Ethical Future
video:video.video:description: Featuring David Choi, AI Researcher, Anthropic.

video:video.video:title: Alaysha Johnson On Her Trajectory To Olympic Athlete
video:video.video:description: Moira Forbes, EVP of Forbes, sits down with Alaysha Johnson, Olympic Hurdler, about her amazing career trajectory from starting out in Track & Field, defying odds, and the importance of building a community.

video:video.video:title: The 2025 Genesis GV80 Coupe Blends Sportiness, Luxury And Practicality
video:video.video:description: The mesh grille, jewel-like headlights and swooping roofline give the Genesis GV80 Coupe a sporty, elegant look. But luxury and power elevate this SUV to new heights.

video:video.video:title: Secrets of New Orleans' Sazerac Bar: Historic Cocktails and Legendary Tales
video:video.video:description: The Sazerac Bar, an enduring symbol of New Orleans' rich cocktail heritage, has a history as captivating as its drinks.

video:video.video:title: The First Bite With XANDRA & GirlBossTown
video:video.video:description: At the 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit, DJ & Content Creator XANDRA, sits down with Robyn Delmonte, Content Creator & Consultant, to talk about all things Cincinnati.

video:video.video:title: Inside Apple's Secretive Global Police Summit
video:video.video:description: At Apple's secretive Global Police Summit at its Cupertino headquarters, cops from seven countries learned how to use a host of Apple products like the iPhone, Vision Pro and CarPlay for surveillance and policing work.

video:video.video:title: Why Is Donald Trump So Popular Among Divorced Men?
video:video.video:description: In 2024 election polling, Donald Trump is dominating one demographic group: divorced men. 56% of divorced men support the former president.

video:video.video:title: Breast Cancer Diagnoses Affect More Than 300,000 Women In US Each Year--But Outcomes Are Improving
video:video.video:description: National Breast Cancer Foundation president Kevin Hail and director of communications Ashley Miller joined ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath at Nasdaq Marketsite to talk about how early detection for breast cancer might be adding to the number of cases seen in the US, but it's helping to lower the death rate from the disease.

video:video.video:title: Stunning New JAMA Study Shows Many People Don't Know They Carry Genes For Breast Cancer
video:video.video:description: Genetic factors play a role in as much as 10% of all cases of breast and ovarian cancer. And yet, according to a new study published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, there is a significant number of patients who are not aware that they carry genetic risk factors for these diseases. Joseph Grzymski, the Chief Genomics Officer for Renown Health--which helped spearhead the study--spoke to ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath about these research findings and what they mean for doctors and patients across the U.S.

video:video.video:title: Why One Of Donald Trump Biggest Buildings Is Losing Money
video:video.video:description: At one of Trump's biggest buildings, profits are down, expenses are up and the mortgage is about to come due. It's all enough to push 40 Wall Street into the red.

video:video.video:title: CEO Hayden Brown Lays Out Upwork's Big Bet On AI
video:video.video:description: Upwork CEO Hayden Brown sits with Forbes Assistant Managing Editor Steven Bertoni to talk about the company's embrace of artificial intelligence, and how it's being incorporated into every aspect of the business.

video:video.video:title: How This 29-Year-Old Entrepreneur Pivoted From Fossil Fuels To Tackling The Solar Industry
video:video.video:description: Shiv Bhakta grew up in Texas, surrounded by energy companies. When he was hired by Exxon Mobil right out of college, it was the first time anyone in his family had held a white collar job; his parents, immigrants from India, hadn't gone to college and instead built a life in America as entrepreneurs. Shiv was thrilled to work at Exxon, but soon realized he wasn't keeping up with his peers. That's when Chris entered his life and completely shifted the trajectory of Shiv's entire career.

video:video.video:title: Gretchen Carlson On Using Your Voice For Equality
video:video.video:description: Moira Forbes, EVP of Forbes, sits down with Gretchen Carlson, Journalist, Author & Adovate, for a discussion on workplace equality, fighting for what's right, and being a role model to women.

video:video.video:title: 2025 Rivian R1S: The Electric SUV Built For Adventure
video:video.video:description: The second generation revamp of this three row, seven passenger off-road capable SUV saw a thorough under-the-hood redesign, from battery and power to the multimedia touchscreen user experience.

video:video.video:title: This Billionaire Builder Wants To Make Homes Affordable
video:video.video:description: Since 2008, Smith Douglas Homes has built 304 communities in five states. Sales hit $765 million in 2023. Shares of Smith Douglas, which Tom Bradbury took public on the New York Stock Exchange in January, are up 56% since then. The 80-year-old Bradbury, who still owns 88% of the stock, is now a billionaire.

video:video.video:title: Inside The Exclusive Club For The World's Wealthiest People
video:video.video:description: From the fabulously rich to the fabulously famous, this remote patch of Montana wilderness has fewer than 900 homeowners, who are worth more than a combined $290 billion.

video:video.video:title: America's Richest Sports Team Owners 2024
video:video.video:description: The top 20 owners on The Forbes 400 have seen their combined fortunes rise by $122 billion over the past year and are now worth more than half a trillion dollars.

video:video.video:title: The Five Youngest Billionaires On The 2024 Forbes 400
video:video.video:description: These relatively youthful moguls have a whole lot of money?and plenty of time to spend it.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Women In Sports: Innovating A New Era Of Freedom
video:video.video:description: At the 2024 Forbes Under 30 Summit, Sherry Phillips, CRO of Forbes, sat down in conversation with Tisha Alyn, Golf Media Personality & Former Professional Golfer, and Shae Dawson, Senior Director of Athlete Relations & Partnership Development Overtime.

video:video.video:title: Where America's Richest People Live: 2024 Forbes 400
video:video.video:description: Almost a quarter of all the wealth on The Forbes 400 is held by residents of one state. Two others tie for second for the first time ever.

video:video.video:title: Meet The New American Billionaires On The 2024 Forbes 400
video:video.video:description: The latest additions to Forbes' annual list got rich doing everything from selling sandwiches to founding private equity firms.

video:video.video:title: How Donald Trump Earned Back His Spot On The Forbes 400
video:video.video:description: In this clip, Chase Peterson-Withorn Senior Editor with Forbes, Luisa Kroll, Executive Editor at Forbes, discuss Donald Trump's wealth and where he ranks on the Forbes 400 List.

video:video.video:title: The Five Richest Women On The 2024 Forbes 400
video:video.video:description: There are more women on The Forbes 400 and they're much richer than last year.

video:video.video:title: Why You Should Care About The Richest People In America
video:video.video:description: In this clip, Chase Peterson-Withorn Senior Editor with Forbes, Luisa Kroll, Executive Editor at Forbes, speak about the importance of The Forbes 400.

video:video.video:title: How T.J. Newman Became A Bestselling Author
video:video.video:description: Behind every great story of business success there is one person?one supporter, mentor, investor or even customer?without whom that success story might not exist. Bestselling author T.J. Newman has Shane Salerno. T.J. was working as a flight attendant when she got the idea for her first book, Falling. She started writing the story on airplane napkins while her passengers slept. Eventually, she had completed a full novel: an action-packed thriller about a pilot who is being blackmailed to crash his plane. But to publish this story, T.J. needed an agent. And so she sent query letter after query letter. Ultimately, 41 agents said no. That's 41 rejection letters. And so, for her 42nd letter?to screenwriter Shane Salerno, whose credits include Avatar and Armageddon?T.J. did a little something different. She included a hand-written note with more than a little bit of confidence. The decision would change the course of her life.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: The Power of Storytelling: Crafting Narratives that Inspire Action
video:video.video:description: The world's most effective sustainability leaders often possess incredible communication skills and know well how to articulate, educate and inspire action through their words. Forbes Associate Editor Elisabeth Brier sits down with Amazon Frontlines Cofounder & Executive Director Mitch Anderson and Amazon Frontlines Cofounder Nemonte Nenquimo to discuss how storytelling techniques, including personal narratives, cultural stories, and media campaigns, can be a powerful tool for mobilizing communities and influencing policy.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Leadership in the Current Climate
video:video.video:description: Forbes Chief Impact Officer Seth Cohen sits down with Rev. Lennox Yearwood Jr., President & CEO of Hip Hop Caucus, and Bill McKibben, Author, Educator, Activist and Founder of Third Act, to discuss how effective leadership is the only way to see an actionable impact on climate change.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Galvanizing Climate Solutions
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Chris Helman sits down with Tom Steyer, Galvanize Climate Solutions Co-Executive Chair, to discuss how the billionaire focuses investments on climate-positive solutions, and the need to move faster because the window of opportunity to limit the worst effects of climate change is closing.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Championing Hope for Our Oceans
video:video.video:description: Forbes Staff Writer Chloe Sorvino talks to Mission Blue Founder & Co-Chair Sylvia Earle about how climate change is impacting our oceans, making meaningful change through honest accounting, and more.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Financing Innovation Across the Capital Spectrum
video:video.video:description: Given the magnitude of the challenge at hand, sustainability leaders are turning to innovative financial solutions that span the entire spectrum of capital - from traditional philanthropy and corporate stewardship initiatives to private equity and impact investing. Forbes Senior Editor Chris Helman sits down with Elemental Impact Founder & CEO Dawn Lippert, U.S. Department of Energy Loan Programs Office Director Jigar Shah, and S2G Ventures Managing Partner Chuck Templeton to discuss how organizations are effectively mobilizing different types of capital to solve the world?s most pressing problems.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Future of Food: Solutions for a Growing World
video:video.video:description: Forbes Research & Insights SVP Janett Haas sits down with Cargill Chief Sustainability Officer Pilar Cruz, Bowery Founder & CEO Irving Fain, and The Nature Conservancy CEO Jennifer Morris, for a conversation about how the circular economy in Agriculture is helping to transform our food system as organizations all along the chain work together to reduce waste and encourage sustainable consumption. This has led to innovative solutions for feeding a growing population, while protecting and conserving water and other natural resources. How can advancements in regenerative agriculture, increased farmer engagement and new business models reshape the way we produce, distribute and consume food?

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Making Big Bets and Tracking Progress
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Amy Feldman talks to Washington State Governor Jay Inslee and Bezos Earth Fund President & CEO Andrew Steer about their ambitious plans to combat climate change, the impact of AI on climate, and much more.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: The Case for Optimism
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Alan Ohnsman sits down with the 68th U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry to discuss the the global transition to low-carbon energy, and despite it moving too slowly and not coming to scale fast enough, he remains optimistic for the future and America's focus on their role to play.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: The Worth of Water
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Amy Feldman sits down with Matt Damon, Cofounder of Water.org & WaterEquity, and Vedika Bhandarkar, President & COO of Water.org, to discuss how they've utilized microloans to help over 69 million people get access to clean water, the impact of climate change on water access, and much more.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Accelerating Impact in the New Energy Era
video:video.video:description: It's time to view sustainability for its ability to generate business value. The Energy Landscape is undergoing intense transformation, driven by new regulatory frameworks and innovations in existing and emerging technologies. Chairman of Schneider Electric, Jean-Pascal Tricoire, sits down with Forbes SVP of Research & Insights, Janett Haas, to discuss how sustainability offers a chance to reshape business models, enhance efficiency throughout the value-chain, and build resilience against increasing risks and disruptions. Hear how Schneider Electric partners with industry leaders to accelerate market impact and achieve net-positive business results.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: The Climate Pledge- Sharing the Knowledge
video:video.video:description: Amazon Chief Sustainability Officer Kara Hurst sits down with Forbes Senior Editor Alan Ohnsman to share an update on their 2019 pledge to stop climate change, transition to renewable energy sources, and reduce carbon emission to zero.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Culture, Policy & Climate Action
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Chris Helman sits down with Urban Ocean Lab Cofounder Ayana Elizabeth Johnson and Waverley Street Foundation President Jared Blumenfeld to discuss the ways policy and culture impact climate change, and how to implement solutions for a cleaner world.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit: Welcome Remarks
video:video.video:description: Forbes Associate Editor Elisabeth Brier welcomes you to the 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit in New York City.

video:video.video:title: The American Billionaires Too Poor To Make The 2024 Forbes 400 List
video:video.video:description: There aren't many things $1 billion won't get you, but a spot on The Forbes 400 list of the richest Americans is one of them. Not even $3 billion will do it. This year, the 400 wealthiest people in the U.S. are all worth at least $3.3 billion, a new record, and $400 million more than last year.

video:video.video:title: The Five Richest Americans On The 2024 Forbes 400
video:video.video:description: A look at the richest people in the US and how they made they're money over the past year.

video:video.video:title: The Billionaire Behind The Making Of America's Next Nuclear-Ready Doomsday Planes
video:video.video:description: Editor, Maggie McGrath, and reporter, Monica Hunter-Hart, discuss Eren Ozmen, the immigrant billionaire behind a $13 billion contract to build the next nuclear-ready Doomsday planes.

video:video.video:title: How America's Richest Billionaires Made Nearly $1 Trillion In A Year
video:video.video:description: Senior Editor, Chase Peterson-Withorn, and Executive Editor, Luisa Kroll, dive into the details of the 2024 Forbes 400 list.

video:video.video:title: How Waabi's Founder Is Implementing AI To Solve Problems With Self-Driving Technology
video:video.video:description: Raquel Urtasun, Founder & CEO of Waabi, has been utilizing AI technology for decades. Now, she's applying generative AI to build better tech for self-driving vehicles. Urtasun discusses how and why she built Waabi to solve these issues facing the trucking industry and how the company is helping to fix the world's supply chain issues.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Toyota Land Cruiser: The Legendary Off-Roader Reinvented For The Future
video:video.video:description: Toyota finally returned the Land Cruiser to North America, and there's a reason it's one of the hottest off-roaders on the market right now.

video:video.video:title: Bourbon & Blockchain: The Future Of Rare Whiskey Trading
video:video.video:description: BAXUS is a global marketplace for the world's most collectible spirits, harnessing the power of blockchain technology to give users proof of ownership, authentication, and a safe storage solution.

video:video.video:title: Sierra Leone Leading By Example: President Bio On Youthful Leadership And Africa's Global Future
video:video.video:description: In an exclusive interview with Sierra Leone's President Julius Maada Bio on the sideline of the United Nations General Assembly in New York City, Seth Cohen, Chief Impact Officer of Forbes, learns how youthful leadership is shaping Africa's future on the global stage. From Sierra Leone's bold initiatives in education and agriculture to advocating for Africa's representation on the UN Security Council, President Bio discusses the power of youth in governance and how innovative, future-focused policies can uplift a new generation of optimistic African leaders.

video:video.video:title: How Snoop Dogg Went From Parental Advisory to Family Favorite
video:video.video:description: Following his golden performance at the Olympics, the hip-hop legend has joined "The Voice" and will release a new Dr. Dre-produced album, all while looking for new ventures to keep his grandchildren set for life.

video:video.video:title: The Case For Optimism | 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit
video:video.video:description: In this conversation from the 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit former Secretary Of State John Kerry and Forbes Senior Editor Alan Ohnsman discuss why Kerry is optimistic about the future of sustainability across the world.

video:video.video:title: The Worth of Water | 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit
video:video.video:description: In this conversation from the 2024 Forbes Sustainability Leaders Summit, Matt Damon, Vedika Bhandarkar and Forbes Editor Amy Feldman discuss the importance of water across the developing world.

video:video.video:title: This Billionaire Is Betting Big On Crypto, Psychedelics And A Doping-Friendly Olympics
video:video.video:description: Christian Angermayer is seemingly behind every flashy investment of the last decade, and now he's getting ready to launch the Enhanced Games, a 21st-century Olympics on steroids... literally.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | bp Spotlight | Growing the Pipeline: Transforming an Energy Sector Workforce
video:video.video:description: bp EVP, people, culture & communications, Kerry Dryburgh, joins Forbes Editor Ali Jackson-Jolley at the Future of Work Summit for a conversation about bp's transition to an integrated energy company and how it's empowering 80,000 employees to help drive the company's strategy and the energy transition.

video:video.video:title: The Risky Path of Coinbase's Brian Armstrong
video:video.video:description: Director of Data and Analytics, Javier Paz, joins Maggie McGrath to discuss Coinbase's future and its chief executive and founder, Brian Armstrong.

video:video.video:title: How A Connection To Jay-Z Changed Everything For Entrepreneur Michael Broughton
video:video.video:description: Michael is the founder of Altro, a fintech company that is helping people build credit through paying their subscriptions on time. Think: Netflix, Amazon Prime, Spotify. The company now operates across 47 states and has $22 million in funding, and Michael was named to the 2023 Forbes 30 Under 30. Michael says there are so many investors and mentors who've helped him on his entrepreneurial journey, but it all started with Maxine Marcus. She approached him after he won his first ever pitch competition and uttered six life-changing words: "You need to meet my dad." It turns out, Maxine's father has a connection to Jay-Z, and her belief in Michael changed the course of his career.

video:video.video:title: Blanca's Revival: The Hidden 12-Seat Restaurant Reimagining Fine Dining
video:video.video:description: Carlo Mirarchi's once Michelin-starred Brooklyn hotspot has returned with Executive Chef Victoria Blamey delivering an immersive, intimate fine dining experience blending seasonal ingredients and culinary artistry across an 18-course tasting menu.

video:video.video:title: Inside BalletX: The Company Revolutionizing The Business Of Dance
video:video.video:description: Under the leadership of Christine Cox (Artistic & Executive Director), BalletX has pushed the boundaries of what the art form is capable of by producing 130 ballets in under 20 years, providing annual salaries to dancers and becoming a fundraising powerhouse.

video:video.video:title: Creator Of First Cannabis-Infused Spirit Explains How He Came Up With Idea | Forbes 30 Under 30
video:video.video:description: Justin Tidwell, Cofounder & CEO, Nowadays, joins Cat Oriel at the Forbes 30 Under 30 Summit to discuss his company creating the first cannabis-infused spirit.

video:video.video:title: Inside The 2024 Lincoln Nautilus With A Panoramic Driver Display That Will Be Copied
video:video.video:description: When you think of the most innovative cars on the road, Lincoln may not be the first to come to mind. The 2024 Lincoln Nautilus changes all that.

video:video.video:title: Cofounder Of Athletic Brewing Company Shares Why Non-Alcoholic Drinks Are The Future
video:video.video:description: From Forbes 30 Under 30 Summit, Bill Shufelt tells us the meaning of 'Athletic Brewing Company and why he decided to invest in non-alcoholic beer company. Bill Shufelt was trader at a hedge fund and an ultramarathon runner who stopped drinking alcohol in 2013. Finding non-alcoholic drinks to be unsatisfactory, he sought out John Walker, a head brewer from Santa Fe to produce better tasting non-alcohol beers. After devising this brewing method, they founded Athletic Brewing in 2017 and established the first brewing facility dedicated to non-alcoholic beer in Stratford, Connecticut, which opened in May 2018.

video:video.video:title: 'We're Going To Be The Dominant State In The Midwest': Ohio Lt. Gov. Bullish On State's Future
video:video.video:description: Ohio Lt. Gov. Jon Husted spoke about the future of his state during Forbes 30 Under 30 Summit 2024. On November 6, 2018, Jon Husted was elected to serve as Lt. Governor of the State of Ohio. Husted also previously served as Ohio Secretary of State, Speaker of the Ohio House of Representatives, and a member of the Ohio Senate.

video:video.video:title: Rmy Martin Celebrates 300 Years Of Cognac With An Eye Toward The Future
video:video.video:description: This July, Rmy Martin brought together industry tastemakers, mixologists and more at Tales of the Cocktail in New Orleans for an anniversary celebration with an eye on the next 300 years.

video:video.video:title: Joe Buck Opens Up About 23 Year Partnership With Troy Aikman
video:video.video:description: From Forbes 30 Under 30 Summit in Cincinnati, Joe Buck shares what makes a great business partnership. Joseph Buck is a sportscaster for ESPN. The son of sportscaster Jack Buck, he worked for Fox Sports from its 1994 inception through 2022, including roles as lead play-by-play announcer for the network's National Football League and Major League Baseball coverage.

video:video.video:title: Recursion Thinks AI Can Lower The High Failure Rate Of New Pharmaceutical Drugs
video:video.video:description: Chris Gibson, Cofounder and CEO of Recursion, lays out how his company is building the biological data, and layering on AI, to assist in the development of new, effective therapeutics.

video:video.video:title: Democrats Will Lose Black Voters Unless They Figure This Out
video:video.video:description: With Black voters making up at least 10 percent of the population in several swing states, Larry Adams, Founder and CEO of XStereotype sat down with Ali Jackson-Jolley to talk about why authenticity and representation in content and political ads are crucial in winning this demographic?s vote.

video:video.video:title: Inside The Wine Club You've Never Heard Of That's Projected To Bring In $125 Million This Year
video:video.video:description: Neha Kumar is the cofounder and COO of Full Glass Wine Co., a direct-to-consumer wine retailer that owns brands like Winc and Splash Wines. In an interview with ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath, Kumar talks about her company's two newest acquisitions and how--despite not having a background in wine--she came to run a digital wine seller.

video:video.video:title: Forbes Travel Guide's Top 14 Wildlife Hotels For Your Next Adventure
video:video.video:description: Not long ago, visiting exotic animals in their habitats was the stuff of intrepid explorers who ventured weeks into remote wilds. Today, sleek new nature lodges bring adventurous luxury to fragile but closely cared-for ecosystems.

video:video.video:title: Inside The $97,000 BMW i5, The 5 Series's First Fully-Electric Variant
video:video.video:description: The completely redesigned 2024 BMW 5 Series is a mid-size luxury sedan that adds the bonus of picking your power: fuel or fully-electric.

video:video.video:title: Sunrun CEO Mary Powell On Making Solar Power Technology People Actually Want
video:video.video:description: Mary Powell, the CEO of Sunrun and a former electric utility chief, thinks she's got a solution to helping secure the US power grid: transform more homes into their own power generation sites, with solar panels and batteries. Her San Francisco-based company hit an industry-first last month by installing solar and battery systems in a million U.S. homes.

video:video.video:title: What The Fearless Fund Settlement Might Mean For The DEI's Future
video:video.video:description: DEI faced another setback last week, as the Fearless Fund announced it would drop its grant program for Black women founders?part of a settlement agreement with the American Alliance for Equal Rights (AAER), the conservative think tank spearheading anti-DEI legal efforts against several business and non-profit institutions. Alphonso David, co-lead counsel to the Fearless Fund and president and CEO for the Global Black Economic Forum sat down with Ali Jackson-Jolley to discuss what's next for the Fearless Fund and other race-based programs.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | Humans In The Age Of AI: Learning, Development And The Future Of Jobs
video:video.video:description: As hype over AI grows and the tool takes over basic tasks of work, leaders face a choice: Cut jobs and use AI for productivity, or use the time created by AI to help people?- and companies - flourish. This transformation - from the "knowledge economy to the relationship economy" - will require a new focus on developing workers' "soft" skills, an investment in training in AI skills and an elevation of the role of HR. A conversation about how to tap the potential for AI to make work more human - rather than more dystopian - with IBM CHRO Nickle LaMoreaux, LinkedIn Chief Economic Opportunity Officer Aneesh Raman, and Deloitte US Chief Learning Officer Anthony Stephan, moderated by Forbes Senior Editor Jena McGregor.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | The Child Care Crush: What Employers Need To Do Now
video:video.video:description: The child care crisis isn't just a women's problem. And it isn't just a working families' problem. It's an economic problem - the biggest bill in many employees' wallets, one of the most common obstacles to keeping women in the workforce and the greatest source of worry and stress for many workers. How can employers do more to help address the crisis, both for their own people and the population at large? A conversation with Moms First founder and activist Reshma Saujani and Forbes EVP Moira Forbes looks at the employers' role in solving the child care crush.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | The ROI Of Child Care: Investing In The Future Of Front Line Workers' Families
video:video.video:description: With pandemic-era child care funding expiring last September - and workforce shortages persisting across the child care industry - the needs of working parents have never been greater, especially for those on tight budgets. Long a benefit for white-collar workers, child care for the front line is a benefit some employers are investing in - and reaping the rewards. Chobani Chief People Officer Shari Eaton and UPS EVP, CHRO & Chief DEI Officer Darrell Ford sit down with Forbes Assistant Managing Editor Ali Jackson-Jolley to discuss the return on investment of child care in the workforce.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | WeWork Spotlight: New Models for a New Future of Work
video:video.video:description: Forbes Chief Revenue Officer Sherry Phillips has a conversation with WeWork?s CEO John Santora about his vision for the company's next chapter, on current trends in the co-working and office sharing market, and the future of the co-working market amid hybrid work that's here to stay.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | Beyond Burnout Band-Aids: Making Work Work Better
video:video.video:description: As workforce anxiety and mental health concerns increase, more attention is turning to their root causes, and the structure of inflexible work itself. From rethinking long hours with four-day workweeks to adopting time flexibility, eliminating meeting bloat and overhauling hustle culture, join Atlassian Global Head of Team Anywhere Annie Dean, Work Time Reduction CEO Joe O'Connor, Better Life Lab Director and Best-selling Author Brigid Schulte, with Forbes Deputy Editor Isabel Togoh for a conversation about what's changing, what's not as job insecurities rise, and what companies can do to make work work better for everyone.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | Calendar Management: AI, Work App Overload And The Future Of Meetings
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Writer & Editor Jabari Young has a conversation with Calendly founder and CEO Tope Awotona about how he's grown his company, the challenges organizations have in managing a sea of workplace software tools and how AI can help improve the future of meetings?and how we manage them.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | Handmade + Human: Leading Etsy's Marketplaces In An Age Of AI
video:video.video:description: Forbes Assistant Managing Editor Steven Bertoni talks to Etsy CEO Josh Silverman about what he's learned from leading in the gig economy with a platform of seven million makers and creative entrepreneurs, how Etsy's approaching hybrid work and workforce upskilling, and how he's deploying AI to adapt to changes in consumer behavior and try to return the company to its artisan roots.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | The How Of Hybrid: Performance, Productivity And Place In A New World Of Work
video:video.video:description: Four years after the pandemic ushered in a new era of remote work, companies are still fixated on where work happens rather than how. Forbes Deputy Editor Isabel Togoh has a conversation with Aeto Strategy & The Leesman Index Cofounder Tim Oldman, Neiman Marcus Group Chief People, ESG & Belonging Officer Eric Severson, and Pinterest Chief People Officer Doniel Sutton about the changes companies are making to how they measure performance, design their workplaces and rethink how teams gather as they balance the demands of hybrid work and flexibility remains favored over forced returns.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | From Talk To Action: Making Skills-Based Hiring A Reality
video:video.video:description: Scores of companies have touted their efforts to drop college diploma requirements from job descriptions, moving away from a focus on degrees and pedigrees to one based on individual skills. But as recent research has shown, progress has been slow, and actual hiring as a result of such efforts still has far to go. Forbes Assistant Managing Editor Ali Jackson-Jolley has a conversation with Accenture Chief Leadership & Human Resources Officer Angela Beatty, Blackstone Senior Managing Director & Global Head of Portfolio Talent & Organizational Performance Courtney della Cava, and OneTen CEO Debbie Dyson about how companies are reshaping their hiring processes, training programs and workplace cultures to help move the needle - and what other changes are needed to make real strides.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | The Future Is Now: The View From AI's Frontier Founders
video:video.video:description: Writer AI Cofounder & CEO May Habib, Tome Cofounder & CEO Keith Peiris, and Harvey Cofounder & CEO Winston Weinberg are three founders from Forbes' AI 50 list of the top artificial intelligence startups, and join Forbes Senior Technology Writer Richard Nieva for a conversation about how companies are adopting AI, the ways it's already impacting how people do their jobs and their predictions for what will - and won't - change most as the technology disrupts the world of work.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit | Midyear Check-In: Lattice's CEO On Skills, Performance And How AI Is Rewiring Work
video:video.video:description: Will AI write better performance reviews - or introduce new challenges? How are HR leaders harnessing tech tools without making work impersonal? How is the new focus on skills reshaping workforce management? Forbes Senior Editor Jena McGregor has a 1:1 conversation with CEO Sarah Franklin about leading Lattice's next chapter, how AI is changing hiring and performance management, and what she's learned about her customers, responsible AI and market demands in her first eight months on the job.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit: Welcome Remarks
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Jena McGregor welcomes you to the 2024 Forbes Future of Work Summit in New York City.

video:video.video:title: In Conversation: The Mayors Of Quezon City And Freetown On Tackling The Challenges Of Climate Change
video:video.video:description: The mayors of Boston, Paris, Freetown, Sierra Leone, and Quezon City, Philippines, made the cut for Forbes' first Sustainability Leaders list. We spoke with two of them about their cities' climate problems and possible solutions.

video:video.video:title: A Deeper Look Into Trump's Fortune With Senior Editor Dan Alexander
video:video.video:description: On Forbes Talks, Senior Editor Dan Alexander has an in-depth chat about the findings of his most recent look into Donald Trump's finances and how they have been affected by his political ties.

video:video.video:title: Christina Lewis Is Building Her Legacy With Lessons Learned From The First Black Businessman To Own A Billion-Dollar U.S. Company
video:video.video:description: Christina Lewis likes to describe herself as a philanthropreneur ? a perfect blend of a for-profit entrepreneur and a mission-oriented philanthropist. It?s a mindset she inherited from her father, the late Reginald F. Lewis. Reginald was a lawyer and entrepreneur and, by the late 1980s, the first Black man to own a billion-dollar business. He died an untimely death in 1993, when Christina was just 12 years old. While most people can say that a parent is ?the one who changed everything? for them, Christina?s story is a little different. As a young adult, she sometimes struggled with the burden of carrying such a big family legacy; in this season of her life, which finds her as the founder of a wealth-management company for women and people of color, she sees all the ways in which her father and his teachings guide her every day decisions.

video:video.video:title: How The American Sign Museum Became A Staple Of Cincinnati Culture
video:video.video:description: When Tod Swormstedt began collecting signs in 1999, it was just him and a dream. The American Sign Museum opened in 2005 and remains the only museum of its kind in the United States to date. "I'm not a hoarder, I'm just a collector," Swormstedt says, and his collection has become a must-visit destination for locals and tourists alike looking for a completely unique experience.

video:video.video:title: How This CEO Leads One Of The World's Largest Diamond Jewelry Retailers
video:video.video:description: Gina Drosos is the CEO of Signet Jewelers, the company behind brands like Zales and Jared. She sat with ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath at Nasdaq MarketSite to discuss the turnaround she's engineered, the way lab-grown diamonds are affecting consumer tastes, and her leadership tactics since taking the top job at the publicly traded company.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit | The Transformer: Igniting Human-Led Innovation In The Age of AI
video:video.video:description: Lumen Technologies CEO, Kate Johnson, joins ForbesWomen Editor Maggie McGrath to talk about whether or not the internet is ready for the AI economy, and what her company is doing to find a fix.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Preserving Humanity in AI
video:video.video:description: A spotlight on Dr. Joy Buolamwini, Founder Of Algorithmic Justice League, who discusses bias in artificial intelligence.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit | The Distiller: Building a Billion-Dollar Legacy
video:video.video:description: Grant Sidney, Inc. and Uncle Nearest, Inc. Founder and CEO Fawn Weaver joins Forbes CCO Randall Lane to discuss how she went from staying in shelters to running the most successful Black-owned liquor company, worth over $1 billion.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Closing Remarks
video:video.video:description: Forbes Executive Vice President Moira Forbes closes out the 2024 Forbes Power Women's Summit in New York City.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Awakening the Boss Within
video:video.video:description: A spotlight on Marketing Executive & Entrepreneur Bozoma Saint John, who talks about how to embrace your strengths and being your best self.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Afternoon Welcome
video:video.video:description: Forbes Chief Revenue Officer Sherry Phillips welcomes you to the 2024 Forbes Power Women's Summit in New York City.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Cultivating Cultures of Care
video:video.video:description: Handshake Chief Talent Engagement Officer Valerie Capers Workman, Chief People Officer Luani Alvarado, and Forbes senior editor Jena McGregor, talk about how to find talent of all ages, retaining a workforce in a post-pandemic generation, and much more,

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit | The Creator: Taking the Entrepreneurial Stage
video:video.video:description: Writer, producer, actress and Hoorae founder Issa Rae joins Forbes EVP Moira Forbes to talk about how the act of storytelling inspires her, and has allowed her to connect as a community with women around the world.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Rewriting Society's Script
video:video.video:description: Producer, Director, Activist, and Emmy-Award winning actress Kerry Washington talks to ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath about utilizing her recently launched production company, Simpson Street, to shine a light on stories from all around the world and from different viewpoints.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit | Icons of Equality: Leading The Charge
video:video.video:description: The Obama Foundation CEO Valerie Jarrett, former Planned Parenthood president Cecile Richards, Entrepreneur and Philanthropist Karlie Kloss, and Me Too Founder/Chief Vision Officer Tarana Burke are joined by Forbes 30/50 vice chair, author and MSNBC contributor Huma Abedin, to discuss the impactful role young women have in shaping the future for everyone.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Unlocking the Untapped Menopause Market
video:video.video:description: Actress and Stripes Founder/CCO Naomi Watts, Google Ventures General Partner Frdrique Dame, and Midi Health CEO/Cofounder Joanna Strober talk to ForbesWomen Editor Maggie McGrath about the key components of the menopause ecosystem - and ensuring that women of all ages have access to great care.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Turning Tragedy Into Triumph
video:video.video:description: A spotlight on Paralympian Ali Truwit, who shares her story of winning two silver medals in Paris less than a year after surviving a shark attack.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Defying Gravity
video:video.video:description: A spotlight on Activist and Astronaut Amanda Nguyen, who shares her story on fighting for justice.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Leading With Purpose
video:video.video:description: Chase Consumer Banking CEO Jennifer Roberts and J. Crew CEO Libby Wadle are joined by Forbes Assistant Managing Editor Steve Bertoni to discuss maintaining authenticity at their decades-old companies, and how they encourage interactive in-person experiences with their customers while still maintaining a strong digital presence.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Owning Your Years
video:video.video:description: A spotlight on stylist and TV host Stacy London to advocate for embracing your power at any age.

video:video.video:title: How To Find The Right Financial Advisor
video:video.video:description: There is tremendous value in having someone in your corner supporting you, someone who can provide you with a roadmap and hold you accountable, someone to act as an objective sounding board, and who can point out your blind spots and correct your form. Whether pursuing an athletic goal, a career goal or a life transition?there are coaches who can help you get there. In the world of personal finance, the coaches are financial advisors. Forbes contributor Natalie Colley explains how to you determine whether and when you need one and what type of advisor is best for your needs.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit | The Visionary: Looking to the Future
video:video.video:description: Author, Philanthropist, and Entrepreneur Lauren Snchez joins Moira Forbes to talk about her career as a journalist that advocated for families on the U.S.-Mexico border, publishing her first children's book, becoming the vice chair of the $10 billion Bezos Earth Fund, and being underestimated despite her long resume of accomplishments.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Afternoon Performance
video:video.video:description: Poet and activist Aija Mayrock gives a performance at the 2024 Forbes Power Women's Summit in New York City.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Erasing The Divide In Maternal Health Access
video:video.video:description: Dr. Asima, Carrot Fertility Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer, and Elaine Welteroth, birthFUND Founder, join Forbes Editor-at-Large Maneet Ahuja to discuss the many problems with the American healthcare system leading to the U.S. having the highest maternal mortality rate of all high-income countries, and what we can do about it.

video:video.video:title: How AI Technology Helped Providence Health System Fix Its Biggest Operational Issue
video:video.video:description: Sara Vaezy, Chief Strategy and Digital Officer of Providence Health System, knew something had to change when the company's in-basket messaging system was overloaded with millions of messages from patients looking to discuss symptoms with their care providers. After evaluating the problems, their goals, and their AI readiness, Vaezy and her team make the decision to adopt AI solutions to fix the problem. As a result, Providence reduced administrative messages by 28% and overall messages by 8%.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Designing Self-Made Success
video:video.video:description: Tory Burch Executive Chairman and CCO, Tory Burch, and Serial Entrepreneur, Emma Grede, talk to The Cut Editor in Chief and Black in Fashion Cofounder, Lindsay Peoples, about how their careers in fashion don't have to follow social media trends. Instead, their massively successful careers center around leaning into their brands' purpose.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit | 9/11 Tribute: Honoring an Unsung Hero
video:video.video:description: Retired FDNY Captain Brenda Berkman honors the fallen heroes of September 11th, and advocates for expanding the stories of 9/11?s female first responders. She teaches women?s history, and urges everyone to use their power and to, in every room, ask ?Where are the women??

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Power Women Summit: Opening Remarks
video:video.video:description: Moira Forbes opens up the 2024 Power Women's Summit in New York City.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Power Women Summit | How Olympic Gymnast Jordan Chiles Redefines Success Beyond Medals
video:video.video:description: Olympic medalist Jordan Chiles discusses redefining success, transforming gymnastics culture, and the Paris 2024 controversy with Moira Forbes, sharing her journey of resilience and vision for the sport's future.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Power Women's Summit: The Multi-Hyphenate Mogul
video:video.video:description: Moira Forbes speaks with Gwyneth Paltrow about the many titles in her lifetime: mother, actress, entrepreneur and CEO. Paltrow talks about starting Goop as a newsletter 16 years ago and turning it into a massive brand, how she views business after turning 50, and much more.

video:video.video:title: How A 144-Year-Old Pottery Business Out Of Cincinnati Became A Global Brand
video:video.video:description: Rookwood Pottery was founded by artist Maria Longworth-Nichols in 1880. Although the business has roots in Ohio, the brand has become an iconic name in the design industry spanning beyond the United States. Forbes spoke with Rookwood Pottery's president Micah Carroll and historian George Hibben at the company's flagship location in Cincinnati to learn how the company has survived and thrived for over a century and how it's positioned to succeed for years to come.

video:video.video:title: How To Rewire Your Money Habits
video:video.video:description: Roughly 70% of Americans have financial regrets from 2023, the most common one is not saving money. But a simple principle completely transformed Forbes contributor Bernadette Joy's ability to build and stick to money habits and become a debt-free millionaire. The 80/20 rule serves as a way to position your habit building, particularly if you are a perfectionist or an overthinker. The habit is simple in theory, but hard in practice: figure out how 20% of your time, resources, and efforts can yield 80% of the results or rewards in your money goals. Here?s how you can apply this principle to your money habits in three different ways.

video:video.video:title: The 2024 Mazda CX-90 Delivers A Luxury SUV For $52,000
video:video.video:description: Mazda's march toward luxury, transitioning from purely popular to a more upscale brand, took a huge leap forward with the introduction of the 2024 Mazda CX-90.

video:video.video:title: How Camp Washington Chili Became A Cultural Staple Of Cincinnati
video:video.video:description: Chili on spaghetti? Only in Cincinnati! This third generation family business is one of the city's oldest establishments and has become a must-visit for locals and tourists alike. Owner Maria Papakirk discusses what it takes to run a restaurant with such an iconic past, and how they're able to produce 60 gallons of chili daily.

video:video.video:title: Simple Budgeting Methods That Can Generate Serious Wealth
video:video.video:description: Budgeting is fundamental to achieving financial well-being. It equips you with the tools to track your income and expenses, identify unnecessary expenditures, and allocate funds toward savings, debt repayment, and investments. Effective budgeting helps fulfill immediate financial obligations. It also lays the groundwork for long-term financial security and independence. Forbes contributor True Tampin urges those looking to build healthy financial habits over time to consider these simple methods.

video:video.video:title: Inside The Cincinnati Open's $260 Million Renovation
video:video.video:description: Now that the Cincinnati Open has committed to Mason, Ohio, for the next 25 years, the tournament sits poised to pour $260 million into a full upgrade of the site. Elizabeth Desrosiers, Director of Marketing & Communications, and Jansen Dell, Director of Design & Construction, joined Forbes to discuss the impact of the Cincinnati Open and what these renovations will afford ticket holders in 2025. Thumbnail: Gensler

video:video.video:title: How Marco Zappacosta Is Positioning Thumbtack For Sustainable Growth
video:video.video:description: Thumbtack CEO Marco Zappacosta sits with assistant managing editor Steven Bertoni to discuss how he built the home service marketplace into a $3 Billion company, the company's Covid roller coaster and the cultural shift to focus on revenue.

video:video.video:title: The $71,000 Lexus GX 550: Where Luxury Meets Adventure
video:video.video:description: As the first full redesign of the Lexus GX in 14 years, the 2024 model brings welcome updates to design and capability.

video:video.video:title: The World's Five Highest-Paid Tennis Players 2024
video:video.video:description: Novak Djokovic got his Olympic gold, but he isn't number one among the top 10 players, who collectively earned $246 million over the last 12 months.

video:video.video:title: The World's Five Highest-Paid Tennis Players 2024
video:video.video:description: Novak Djokovic got his Olympic gold, but he isn't number 1 among the top 10 players, who collectively earned $246 million over the last 12 months.

video:video.video:title: Trump Ordered Cabinet Secretary To Pressure Fed Chair Jerome Powell
video:video.video:description: In his new book, one-time Trump cabinet member Wilbur Ross claims the then-president threatened to remove Powell as Fed chairman if he kept raising rates, a policy that not only affected everyday Americans but hurt Trump's personal finances.

video:video.video:title: How Two Designers Built A Celebrity-Favorite Fashion Brand With Zero Capital Raised
video:video.video:description: An LVMH Prize 2023 finalist, Paolina Russo is a London-based fashion brand founded by Paolina Russo and Lucile Guilmard. The knitwear brand is influenced by Russo's suburban upbringing in Canada, and Guilmard's French folklore references. In 2020, Russo struck a deal to sell her thesis collection of knitwear at the Montreal-based luxury retailer Ssense and inked a deal with Adidas to design a collection for Adidas Originals, as well as Olympic-themed pieces timed to the Tokyo Games. In November 2023, Russo partnered with digital fashion platform Sknups to translate three key looks of its fall 2023 collection for Roblox. This year, the pair landed a deal with Nordstrom, which will stock the brand's pieces as of this month. Celebrities like Rihanna, Kim Kardashian, Caroline Polachek, FKA Twigs, Kylie Jenner and Phoebe Bridgers have been spotted wearing their designs.

video:video.video:title: FidoCure CEO Thinks Drugs For Dogs Can Help Humans Fight Cancer
video:video.video:description: Christina Lopes is the Founder and CEO of FidoCure, a company developing canine cancer drugs, and mining that data to help develop treatments to help humans fight those same diseases. She sat down with Maggie McGrath, editor of ForbesWomen, to discuss her career and how she's built FidoCure.

video:video.video:title: Cincinnati's Ghost Baby Wants To Change The Way People Experience Nightlife
video:video.video:description: Ghost Baby is not your normal bar. The subterranean venue in the heart of Cincinnati, Ohio encourages patrons to put down their devices and live in the moment by offering creative cocktails and outstanding live music in one of the most unique locations in the state. Owner Josh Heuser discusses how he turned his vision for Ghost Baby into a reality.

video:video.video:title: The 'Invisible' Constituency Trump And Harris Must Pay Attention To: College Student Parents
video:video.video:description: On "Forbes Newsroom," Nicole Lynn Lewis, Founder and CEO of Generation Hope, spoke to Maggie McGrath about the challenges and policies most important to college student parents, who represent one in four college students nationally, how this constituent group has been underserved, and how the policies of former President Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris will affect them.

video:video.video:title: Bonding With The 671hp Aston Martin DB12
video:video.video:description: The DB12 introduces a whole new era of technological prowess and style for Aston Martin, solidifying the automaker's reputation for producing world-class luxury sports cars.

video:video.video:title: Worst Case Scenario: Bestselling Author T.J. Newman Reveals Latest Book
video:video.video:description: Bestselling novelist T.J. Newman discusses her third book, Worst Case Scenario, with Forbes Senior Editor Maggie McGrath.

video:video.video:title: Bestselling Novelist T.J. Newman Reveals Her Favorite Author: 'You Can't Be A Writer If You're Not Reading'
video:video.video:description: Bestselling novelist T.J. Newman discusses her favorite author and the power of reading as writer with Forbes Senior Editor Maggie McGrath.

video:video.video:title: Nikola's Hydrogen Trucks Wants To Clean Up The Trucking Industry
video:video.video:description: The struggling electric truckmaker sells the first commercial hydrogen fuel cell truck in the U.S., with double the range of battery models, and so far, drivers love them.

video:video.video:title: Nikola's Hydrogen Trucks Wants To Clean Up The Trucking Industry
video:video.video:description: The struggling electric truckmaker sells the first commercial hydrogen fuel cell truck in the U.S., with double the range of battery models, and so far, drivers love them.

video:video.video:title: Inside The Business of The Harlem Globetrotters
video:video.video:description: Keith Dawkins, president of the Harlem Globetrotters and Herschend Entertainment Studios, discusses the reinvention of the nearly 100-year-old brand with Forbes senior writer and ForbesBLK editorial lead Jabari Young at the Nasdaq MarketSite.

video:video.video:title: How Tales Of The Cocktail Is Shaping The Future Of The Hospitality Industry
video:video.video:description: Each year, the world's top bartenders and spirits industry leaders gather in New Orleans for Tales of the Cocktail, where passion, innovation, and community shape the future of mixology.

video:video.video:title: Mookie Betts' Multimillion-Dollar Dreams: Baseball, Bowling, and Business
video:video.video:description: In 2018, Mookie Betts became the first player in baseball history to win Most Valuable Player, a Gold Glove, a Silver Slugger, the batting title and a World Series in the same year. Now the Dodgers All-Star shortstop has a new game plan to become a bowling kingpin.

video:video.video:title: The Redesigned 2024 Range Rover Sport Comes With A Cool Mini-Fridge
video:video.video:description: The 2024 Range Rover Sport has been completely redesigned, top to bottom, rethinking all of its design and its approach to everything it does.

video:video.video:title: The 30 Percent Rule: How NFL Players Can Benefit From This Financial Advice
video:video.video:description: Former NFL linebacker Brandon Copeland sat down with Forbes senior writer Jabari Young at the Nasdaq MarketSite to discuss financial literacy tips for NFL players as the 2024 season nears. Copeland also shared insights into his real estate portfolio and provided guidance on getting started with investing."

video:video.video:title: This Next Billion-Dollar Tech Startup Lets You Build AI Models Cheaper And Faster
video:video.video:description: The startup aims to help businesses ship new AI products in as few as five days at minimal cost.

video:video.video:title: These Next Billion-Dollar Founders Raised $110 Million To Treat Eating Disorders Virtually
video:video.video:description: Equip has convinced health insurers to pay for research-backed treatment for thousands of patients struggling with one of the deadliest mental health disorders.

video:video.video:title: This Next Billion-Dollar Startup Founder Is Helping People Pay Their Bills
video:video.video:description: Phaedra Ellis-Lamkins built Promise into a $520 million powerhouse by helping municipalities and utilities collect unpaid bills with zero-interest payment plans.

video:video.video:title: Inside Airtable's Post-Pandemic Pivot With CEO Howie Liu
video:video.video:description: Airtable Founder and CEO Howie Liu sits with Forbes Assistant Managing Editor Steven Bertoni to talk about building the company, and how he's led it through big operational and cultural changes over the past four years.

video:video.video:title: This Next Billion-Dollar Startup Wants To Save American Manufacturing
video:video.video:description: Hadrian, a high-tech factory, makes parts for rockets and fighter jets 10 times faster.

video:video.video:title: Ali Truwit Swims Toward Gold at the 2024 Paralympic Games
video:video.video:description: Team USA swimmer Ali Truwit talks to Moira Forbes about losing her leg in a devastating shark attack, and turning that trauma into motivation to compete in the 2024 Paris Paralympic Games less than one year later.

video:video.video:title: A Deeper Look Into The Next Billion-Dollar Startups List With Senior Editor Amy Feldman
video:video.video:description: A deep dive into this year's list and a look back at the last ten.

video:video.video:title: Director Ava DuVernay: How Technology Democratized Filmmaking
video:video.video:description: Filmmaker, producer and director Ava DuVernay is the first Black woman to be nominated by the Academy as a director in a feature category. She was the first woman of color to direct a $100-million-grossing film, the 2018 Disney fantasy adaptation of A Wrinkle in Time. Her Emmy-winning series When They See Us, which premiered in May 2019, became the most-watched series on Netflix. In addition to her distribution company, ARRAY, she opened the LA-based Amanda Theater in October 2019. In November 2018, DuVernay signed a $100 million deal with Warner Brothers. She landed a spot on the Forbes 50 Over 50 in August 2024.

video:video.video:title: Director Ava DuVernay Is Tired Of Being Hollywood's Chief Progress Report Officer
video:video.video:description: Filmmaker, producer and director Ava DuVernay is the first Black woman to be nominated by the Academy as a director in a feature category. She was the first woman of color to direct a $100-million-grossing film, the 2018 Disney fantasy adaptation of A Wrinkle in Time. Her Emmy-winning series When They See Us, which premiered in May 2019, became the most-watched series on Netflix. In addition to her distribution company, ARRAY, she opened the LA-based Amanda Theater in October 2019. In November 2018, DuVernay signed a $100 million deal with Warner Brothers. She landed a spot on the Forbes 50 Over 50 in August 2024.

video:video.video:title: Game Changers: How New York Liberty CEO Keia Clarke Is Transforming the WNBA
video:video.video:description: Moira Forbes sits down with CEO of the New York Liberty, Keia Clarke, to discuss her path to leading the WNBA team, her goals for the future, and how she defines power.

video:video.video:title: Meet The 2024 Refugee Olympic Team Competing For Gold
video:video.video:description: Forbes Senior Editor Maggie McGrath and Kelly T. Clements, Deputy High Commissioner in the Office of the United Nations for Refugees, to the Paris Olympics 2024, speak on the Refugee Olympic team and how the program grew to 37 athletes.

video:video.video:title: 2024 Forbes Top CPAs Celebration
video:video.video:description: For business owners, corporations and individuals looking for a CPA, it?s not enough for them to simply be professionals in good standing. A blend of financial genius, innovation, deskside manner and trustworthiness are what make a CPA truly exceptional. Forbes? first-ever list of America?s Top CPAs recognizes these accountants at the top of their game, honoring professionals from across America. Join Forbes in New York City as we celebrate the inaugural class of America?s Top 200 CPAs. This exclusive, invitation-only event will feature engaging conversations, networking and of course some well-earned recognition among your peers.

video:video.video:title: How Sarah Leary Is Building Communities At Scale With Nextdoor
video:video.video:description: Sarah Leary has returned to Nextdoor, the company she cofounded, as Head of Marketing, Community and Global Business Operations. In an interview with ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath, Leary speaks on her career journey and Nextdoor's evolution.

video:video.video:title: Ramp CEO Opens Up About The Challenges Of Rapid Growth
video:video.video:description: Ramp, a $7.65 billion corporate credit card and expense company, makes its debut on the Forbes Cloud 100 list, riding the generative AI wave.

video:video.video:title: How Jersey Mike's Owner Built A $6 Billion Empire
video:video.video:description: The story behind Jersey Mike's Subs and its founder, Peter Cancro.

video:video.video:title: Inside the First Electric Rolls-Royce: The $560,000 Spectre
video:video.video:description: Not having to sully your hands at the gas pump is just the first luxury in the Rolls-Royce Spectre, but its 577 hp and 664 pound-feet of torque give this car the feel of an opulent vessel soaring through space.

video:video.video:title: Inside The Cloud 100 2024: The World's Top Private Cloud Companies
video:video.video:description: Category leaders such as DocuSign, PagerDuty, Twilio and Toast have joined the Cloud 100 ranks, scaled into enterprises, transformed their given industries and gone on to IPO. Here's how these esteemed companies, the definitive cohort of top-performing cloud businesses, end up on the list.

video:video.video:title: Ava DuVernay Is Directing The Future Of Moviemaking
video:video.video:description: The Hollywood filmmaker is breaking the norm in securing independent financing for her projects. She sat down with ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath to talk about how she's finding freedom to make the stories she feels she "needs" to tell.

video:video.video:title: How Brooke Shields Keeps Growing The Business Of Brooke Shields
video:video.video:description: Brooke Shields has been taking direction as a model and an actor since the age of 11 months. Now, she's the founder and CEO of haircare company Commence, and she spoke with ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath about how her entrepreneurial success is tied to her overall image.

video:video.video:title: Dawn Staley Asserted Her Value - And Has Found Her Purpose As Coach
video:video.video:description: This year, Dawn Staley coached the University of South Carolina's women's basketball team to a perfect season and its third championship under her leadership. Her new contract makes her one of the highest-paid coaches in women's basketball, and she spoke to ForbesWomen editor Maggie McGrath about what it took to assert herself during contract negotiations.

video:video.video:title: Miriam Rivera Betting On Longshots - And Finding Unicorns
video:video.video:description: Miriam Rivera was born to a pair of migrant farmers and learned English by watching Sesame Street. Today, she's the cofounder of Ulu Ventures, a Palo Alto-based VC firm that looks for founders who might seem like longshots but are ultimately profitable.

video:video.video:title: Peggy Johnson Wants Humanoid Robots To Do The Jobs People Won't
video:video.video:description: Agility Robotics CEO Peggy Johnson sees opportunity in an American labor shortage. The company's humanoid robots have already been put to work commercially. Johnson doesn't think they'll displace human workers, she tells Forbes, but rather make them more productive.

video:video.video:title: 'Deadpool & Wolverine' Hits $30 Billion Global Record Its Opening Weekend
video:video.video:description: The first and only major release of the year in the Marvel Cinematic Universe delivered a major boost to the box office and the franchise as a whole, which hit the $30 billion global gross mark with the $444.3 million worldwide opening of ?Deadpool & Wolverine??as the latest Deadpool film broke several domestic records over the weekend.

video:video.video:title: Inside The $79,000 Genesis GV80, A True Luxury SUV
video:video.video:description: For 2025, the Genesis GV80 adds new features that increase its elegance, just another reason its fans don't want you to know about it.

video:video.video:title: This $370,000 Bentley Continental GTC Is About To Get a Major Redesign
video:video.video:description: Super luxury cars rarely impose dramatic redesigns, but the 2024 Bentley Continental GT Convertible marks the end for some iconic brand details.

video:video.video:title: Cindy Parlow Cone On Going From Athlete To Executive
video:video.video:description: Moira Forbes, EVP of Forbes, sits down with Cindy Parlow Cone, President of the U.S. Soccer Federation, for an insightful discussion on how to change roles within your career, being a team player, and the future of women's soccer.

video:video.video:title: How To Build Generational Wealth In 6 Steps
video:video.video:description: It can be difficult to know where to start when it comes to creating generational wealth. Speaking with your children about money, investing for the future, moderating debt, having an estate plan, utilizing life insurance, and using current laws in your favor are steps you can take to create generational wealth.

video:video.video:title: The Highest-Paid Athletes At The Paris Olympics
video:video.video:description: LeBron James will be the first self-made billionaire to compete in the Summer Games, but who else stands on the earnings podium in basketball, tennis, golf and other sports?

video:video.video:title: Inside Nike's New Collab: A High-Tech Recovery Boot
video:video.video:description: Jim Huether, CEO of recovery technology company Hyperice, joins Forbes senior writer Jabari Young at the Nasdaq MarketSite to preview the firm's innovative pre-recovery electronic sneaker with apparel giant Nike. The devices, called the Nike x Hyperice is capable of cooling, heating and massaging feet during pre-workouts. Huether also updates Hyperice's previously reported $850 million valuation and its relationship with NBA star Ja Morant.

video:video.video:title: Hyundai IONIQ 5 N: The Most Fun You Can Have In An EV?
video:video.video:description: With 601 horsepower and growly engine sounds, this electric car behaves like a gas-powered beast.

video:video.video:title: How Bruce Springsteen Became A Billionaire
video:video.video:description: The story behind the rockstar's ride to becoming a billionaire.

video:video.video:title: How Bruce Springsteen Became a Billionaire
video:video.video:description: The story behind the rockstar's ride to becoming a billionaire.
